intro: Pteris chilensis, commonly known as the Chile fern, is a species of fern native to South America, particularly Chile and Argentina. It belongs to the family Pteridaceae and is characterized by its delicate, feathery fronds that are typically bi- or tri-pinnate. The plant prefers moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Its rhizomes are creeping and produce both roots and new shoots, allowing it to spread vegetatively. The spores are released from sori located on the underside of the fronds, contributing to its reproductive strategy.
